intro: Rubus panormitanus, commonly known as the Panormitanus blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
